content: I’m a Boomer of average intelligence who has a hard time understanding the concept of electricity, but can firmly grasp the concept of human intervention. Reading this distracted me to the point where all I could think about was Wall-E and Donald Trump. I think there’s an extreme disconnect between what the future looks like to folks like me and folks like Steve. The former knows we’re “extincting” ourselves, and the latter doesn’t see the forest for the trees. What good is technology, if no one’s here to use it? Another concept I firmly grasp is “priorities”. Why wouldn’t saving the planet be a more pressing scientific endeavor, than not having to push buttons on a microwave? Excuse me, but I need to go take a walk in the forest while it’s still here.
